bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to William Crawford Gorgas, October 14, 1919

div1.p: Carter writes that he will be able to join Gorgas in January 1920.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to William Crawford Gorgas, October 14, 1919
div1.opener:
Misscl.
Y. F.
Gorgas
/LC
Baltimore, Md.,
October 14, 1919.
General W. C. Gorgas,
% International Health Board,
61 Broadway,
New York, N. Y.
Dear Doctor Gorgas:
div1.p:
Your letter of September 15/19, written aboard the Lima,
just received.

I should think I will be able to go with you in January.
There is no question about health as I have been on duty since
August 2nd. and have done a fair amount of work, some of it field
work, since then.

The question will be whether I can be of more use in the
yellow fever work or in the malaria. I will come over to see you
when you get back and talk this over with you. The yellow fever
work in 1916 was far easier than the work I have been doing in ma-
laria. We have quite a full schedule of work on hand. Let me know
then when you return to the United States.

I am sending a copy of this to your Washington address, so that
if the original misses you the copy will not.

Remember me most kindly to Lyster and Connor, if you see them
after getting this, or to Mrs. Gorgas and Aileen if the copy reaches
you.
